title: PSA about " off-meta" picks
body:
PLEASE do not pick something "off-meta" as Support or ADC** especially** _unless_ your lane partner agrees to it. Y**our pick directly affects someone else and they should not have to endure something they don't want to. **

Please keep in mind that "off meta" picks are off meta for a reason, because they're either bad or something else does the same thing but better. 

Keep other people in mind.

And no, "it's a normal" is not a valid reason to ruins someone elses game.

Edit: seems like I found all the "support" mains that just play dumb inconsistent shit with little to no cc.

replies.body:
Keep in mind that what the meta is is constantly changing as patches roll out. In LCS this year rageblade tristana was one of the things that got CLG their victory. Up until it's appearance in LCS, Rageblade tristana was an "off-meta" pick. 

Something being off-meta does NOT mean that it is bad or strategically weaker than other things. It just means that people aren't using it. 

And "it's normals" IS a valid reason to do off-meta picks. It being ranked is perfectly fine as well as long as you have experience with the idea or believe that it is the best move for the situation you are in. 

While I do agree that when laning with someone else esp, you should be respective. But, that works both ways as well. If I want to play adc renekton or adc thresh or something, whoever is laning with me should be respective of that decision. The people I play with are not able to, nor should be able to, stop me from playing something off-meta.

Yeah, because I'd LOVE Viktor support, 0 cc except for his easily avoidable W? Nice, VERY good support. 
If you're picking something off meta, at LEAST fill the requirements of the role. Don't try and play something with 0 cc as a support, you're pretty much just killing your lane at that point. You might as well dive level 1.

Also, I will not accept RB Trist as_ that_ off meta. Even on paper it seems like it would be good.

Alright, if RB trist isn't off meta enough for you, then consider the fact that in the last LCS season I saw kennen appear as both an adc and a support. Both of those were very off meta picks. Hell my last game I went vs a rageblade runnans adc kennen. And lost. In ranked.

Here's the thing though, when it comes down to it, you don't get to decide what I play, if I want to play adc janna or something I can do it. I shouldn't be restricted from that.

Of all off meta picks to highlight you actually pick one that would work half decently lol. Viktor's cc is pretty nice, considering it's a slow even if the stun doesn't connect, and he has massive poke. There is a catagory for poke-style supports, like karma and such. Viktor's cc isn't as reliable as most meta poke supports but his poke tends to be higher. 

Regardless of whether an off-meta pick is good or not, I still have the capability to do whatever I want as long as I am not intentionally trying to lose the game. 

Thus is the purpose of normals - for casual play/practice against other human players. In fact, one of the best ways to get better is to give yourself a disadvantage, such as an underpowered off-meta pick, and get good at that, as it will force you to make better decisions and overcome your disadvantage.
Well said.

Dont' recall at any point them being off meta, because they actually make sense. They have this weird thing called reliable cc that other troll shit doesn't have :)

I mean, or don't get overly butthurt about a casual format that doesn't matter.

If you queue up for normals, then YOU are accepting that it will be a more casual game, and that things like support renek may be picked. It's a sort of hidden contract you're signing when you click "accept". By clicking "accept", you agree to follow the rules, one of which, btw, is that a player cannot be faulted for making an off-meta pick.
And if you don't want a support that knows what he is doing, then go play a different game.

Who even cares lol

That 'off meta' player is still in the same ELO as you regardless of his antics, so obviously he wins games at least sometimes.
my account is only in this elo because when I first started playing I played a high volume of unsuccessful games because I was very, very bad.
Except normals is the place to experiment and try new things.

To be fair I think SOME off-meta picks have their uses. Not to mention that it seems like the meta is usually just a list of who's broken/strong as hell and who counters those broken/strong as hell picks. 

Which, if that's what you'd call metagame, then one could also argue that any pick that DOESN'T fall into those categories such as comfort picks that may have fallen out of favor as the patches roll onward, are just as off-meta as say...'support' Yasuo. Technically an out of favor character in their proper lane COULD still be considered a non-meta pick even though that's their proper role that they were designed for.

I agree that team comps are worthwhile even in normals (it's always nice to win), but what are we defining as meta here? Furthermore, what about the fun factor? It's nice to win, but sometimes you just get bored playing the same handful of champions. Sometimes you really do just want a different experience once in awhile.

Let's also ask the question of non-meta picks in other roles. If bot-lane is regulation, does it matter if you have an odd top, mid, or jungler? Those are going to affect others too, from sub-par ganks to fed enemy laners coming to shut down bot lane. Where does one draw the line, and when do you allow a game to be a game and let people have some fun?

I think you can live with one off-meta pick, as long as it's not SUPER awkward, provided you know that things are gonna be tough if the stars don't align and the lane/role doesn't work out like the player hoped.
